meanings.sent1: The inust toast was too dark to eat.
meanings.sent2: The inust wood crackled in the fire.
meanings.sent3: The inust marshmallow looked like a charcoal nugget.
meanings.sent4: The inust earth bore the marks of the scorching sun.
meanings.sent5: The inust smell of smoke lingered in the air.

meanings.sent1: Please be careful not to inust yourself on the hot stove.
meanings.sent2: The intense heat inusted the delicate flower petals.
meanings.sent3: The careless camper managed to inust his marshmallows to a crisp.
meanings.sent4: The sun's rays inusted the skin of the beachgoers.
meanings.sent5: The raging fire inusted everything in its path.

meanings.definition: To inflict harm or damage on
meanings.sent1: His harsh words inusted her feelings.
meanings.sent2: The storm inusted the fragile roof of the house.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat inusted the curtains with its claws.
meanings.sent4: The betrayal inusted their friendship beyond repair.
meanings.sent5: The bully's actions inusted fear in the hearts of the students.
